title: Improving the quality of Web-mined Parallel Corpora of Low-Resource Languages using Debiasing Heuristics
author: Aloka Fernando (University of Moratuwa), Surangika Ranathunga (Massey University), Nisansa de Silva (University of Moratuwa), ...
relevance_why: The paper deals with improving the quality of parallel corpora, which could enhance training data for audio processing tasks involving language translation or understanding, potentially benefiting methods in speech synthesis.
background: The study focuses on filtering noisy parallel sentences from web-mined corpora to improve the quality of training data for Neural Machine Translation (NMT) systems.
contribution: This paper introduces heuristic methods to remove noise from parallel corpora to enhance Neural Machine Translation outcomes.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous techniques primarily relied on ranking sentence pairs using multimodal embeddings without adequately addressing noise variability.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work employs a combination of heuristic filtering strategies that specifically target noise types prevalent in low-resource language pairs.

key_innovation: Combines multiple heuristics for noise reduction tailored to specific language characteristics, leading to improved training dataset quality.
real_world_impact: Enhances the reliability and effectiveness of neural translation systems for low-resource languages, potentially impacting applications in multilingual communication and technology access.

new_terms.Parallel Data Curation: **Parallel Data Curation** refers to the process of refining parallel corpora to reduce noise and improve quality for machine translation tasks.
new_terms.debiasing heuristics: **Debiasing heuristics** are specific methods designed to counteract biases in data, in this case, to filter out low-quality sentence pairs.
